task_summary: Perceive the T-shaped block, approach and establish gentle contact with a circular tool, push it along a diagonal path toward the fixed T-outline target, then verify final alignment and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A tabletop manipulator with a circular end-effector must push a T-shaped block toward a fixed target outline on the workspace. The sequence begins with perception and localization, followed by a safe approach from above and alignment to the blockâ€™s edge. After establishing contact, the tool yaw is set for side pushing. Multiple short pushes move the block toward the target, ending with a brief alignment near the target outline and a retreat to clear the scene. Timing is modest, suitable for 10 Hz observation/control, but enforced via action timeouts.
preconditions: T-shaped block is on the table
Target outline is visible on the surface
stepwise_plan: Detect or scan to localize the T-shaped block
Move above and align to a push-friendly edge with tight tolerance
Lower until contact with low force
Execute several push segments toward the target direction
success_criteria: Block overlaps the target outline within small pose error
No loss of contact during push segments
End-effector retreats clear of the block and target
failure_and_recovery: If the block is not visible, raster scan and retry
If contact is not detected, re-approach and reattempt pushing
If the block deviates, re-align and perform additional short pushes
task_long_description.termination: Tree succeeds when final alignment near the target completes and the robot retreats; it fails if perception or motion steps exceed retries or timeouts.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Checks whether the T-shaped block is currently visible to perception.
Raster scan to localize the T-shaped block if not immediately visible.
Moves the tool to a pre-push height directly above the block.
Approaches the block edge and aligns the tool with tight tolerance for pushing.
Descends slowly until contact with the block is detected.
Sets tool yaw for lateral pushing along the table.
Executes a short push segment in a diagonal direction toward the target.
Performs a brief alignment near the target outline to settle pose.
Backs away to clear the workspace after placement.

failure_modes: Object not detected due to glare or occlusion
No contact established; tool too high or misaligned
Push overshoots or rotates the T unexpectedly
Target outline misinterpreted causing wrong final alignment
recovery_strategy: Invoke raster scan and retry perception
Re-approach with tight tolerance, then lower until contact again
Execute additional small push segments and re-align
Adjust yaw and repeat short pushes toward the outline
assumptions: Frames show a red T-block and blue target outline, while the instruction describes gray block and green target; frames were treated as authoritative
Exact push direction estimated as diagonal (225 deg) based on contact-sheet geometry
Verification near target is approximated with an align step due to limited library support for object-at-goal checks

expected_success_criteria: T-block lies within the target outline within a small tolerance and remains stable after retreat
